column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Andagua
#Text=Andagua is a town in southern Peru about 200 km northwest of the city of Arequipa , between the Colca and Cotahuasi canyons .
#Text=It is the major centre for visits to the Valle de Los Volcanes ( Valley of Volcanoes . )

#Text=As with most Peruvian towns , Andagua is centred around a main plaza , in this case filled with bushes clipped into a variety of shapes ( and often with sheep or alpacas brought in to trim the grass . )
#Text=Understand
#Text=Though the local authorities have been trying to develop tourism in the area , the Valle de Los Volcanes and Andagua are still far off the southern Peruvian tourist circuit .
#Text=As a result tourist facilities are limited .
#Text=However this also means that it provides a fine opportunity to see the traditional rural way of life on the Peruvian altiplano , relatively untouched by outside influences .
#Text=Andagua 's residents are very friendly , and virtually everyone you meet will at least offer a pleasant greeting or , more often , stop to chat for a bit .
#Text=Because the town is so far removed from main tourist routes , virtually no English is spoken .
#Text=As such at least a bit of Spanish language skill will be very helpful when visiting the area .
#Text=Get in
#Text=There are two primary routes into Andagua : from the south or the north .
#Text=From the south
#Text=buses run directly from Arequipa ( 10-11 hours , over poor roads ) .
#Text=Reyna Tours buses depart daily from the Terrepuerto depart at 16:00 , arriving at around 02:30 the following morning ( S/40 ( soles ) as of April 2013 . )
#Text=It is also possible to catch this service as it passes through the towns of Corire ( ~20:00 ) or Aplao ( ~21:30 . )

#Text=These towns can be reached directly from Arequipa or from Nazca or other coastal cities by taking an Arequipa-bound bus , then changing buses at the turnoff from the main road , about 60km inland from the town of Camana .
#Text=The journey is breathtaking , passing through dizzyingly deep river valleys and over a 4800-m pass on the shoulder of 6425-m Volcan Coropuno .
#Text=Most of the bus journey takes place in the dark .
#Text=The very early arrival times of the Reyna tours buses can also be problematic .
#Text=From the north it is possible to reach the mining town of Orcopampa via collectivos from Cabanconde in the Colca Canyon .
#Text=The daily Reyna tours bus departs Orcopampa for Andagua at 14:00 , arriving around 16:00 .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Andagua is a small town .
#Text=All of the town and most of the nearby sights can be reached on foot .
#Text=The plaza principal is at the centre of town with the church on its north side and the municipality office on the west .
#Text=See
#Text=Andagua is set in a spectacular location near the head of the Valle de Los Volcanes ( Valley of Volcanoes . )
#Text=It is surrounded by small volcanic cones ranging from about 50 m to 300 m high , many of which can be easily climbed for views out over the town , fields and valley .
#Text=Ancient lava flows cover large expanses near the town and towering mountains and cliffs form the valley walls .
#Text=Once you get beyond the irrigated areas near town the arid landscape of the area is particularly impressive , filled with a variety of cacti and other desert flora .
#Text=Alpine lakes , rivers and waterfalls dot the area around Andagua .
#Text=Wildlife that can be spotted in the area include Andean Condors , the giant hummingbird , and wild vicuñas .
#Text=Man made attractions include the large pre-Colombian ruins of Antaymarca , 3 km south of town .
#Text=The ruins are fairly well preserved and unusual in that they are constructed entirely of black volcanic rock on top of a lava flow .
#Text=Nearer to town the traditional pastures and farm fields , all surrounded by rough stone walls are worth exploring as well .
#Text=The cemetery to the west of town is a veritable forest of large wooden crosses and crypts and is also worth a look .
#Text=Do
#Text=The valley is a superb area for hiking .
#Text=The above attractions can generally be reached on foot using well worn paths or rough roads .
#Text=Most sights are marked with large stone signs , though the signs are sometimes difficult to read and follow .
#Text=However finding your way is n't too difficult , as any locals you meet while walking will invariably be happy to help out with directions .
#Text=The walk out to the Antaymarca ruins and the mirador immediately above them is easy ( except for the final climb up to the mirador ) and especially worthwhile .
#Text=Most sights are also reachable by mountain bike , or as part of a horse or llama trek .

#Text=A free pamphlet ( Spanish only ) outlining the main tourist attractions of the area is available at the Municipality building on the west side of the plaza ( open 09:30 - 13:30 and 14:30 - 16:30 ) .
#Text=The entrance is , rather confusingly , not through the main doors but to their right into the courtyard containing the public toilets , then upstairs .
#Text=The municipality staff can also arrange local guides ( S/30-50 per day ) and horses or llamas for longer treks .
#Text=Eat
#Text=A number of small shops line the plaza selling cookies , bread , cheese , fruits and vegetables , soft drinks , etc.
#Text=There are two restaurants in town .
#Text=The more central of the two is on the southwest corner of the plaza ( in the shop with the Trebol Bus company sign above the door . )
#Text=Two-course breakfast and lunch menus are available at the appropriate times of day for about S/6 .
#Text=The other restaurant is open for breakfast lunch and dinner .
#Text=It can be reached by heading west from the centre of the plaza past the Hostal Trebol .
#Text=It is about 300 m from the plaza , just after the road makes a right turn .
#Text=A shop on the south side of the plaza sells very good fresh yogurt in the afternoons .
#Text=Thicker and less sweetened than the drinking yogurt that is popular elsewhere in Peru ( S/1 per glass ) .
#Text=The same shop sells fried snacks and sandwiches in the evening .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Hostal Trebol , Calle 15 Agosto #106 ( About 150m west from the centre of the plaza . ) , ☏ +5154834065 , ✉ hostal_trebol_andagua_castilla@hotmail.com .
#Text=The most comfortable option in town .
#Text=Private rooms ( singles and doubles available ) include bathroom , hot water , cable TV and new , clean beds .
#Text=S/20 per person per night .
#Text=Hostal Puca Mauras ( near the northeast corner of the plaza . ) .
#Text=Slightly rundown but less expensive than the Trebol .
#Text=It can be difficult to rouse hotel owners when the bus from Arequipa arrives at 02:30 , so it may be necessary to spend a few hours waiting in the plaza until morning .
#Text=It 's entirely safe , but can be quite cold at night , so be sure to have warm clothes handy when you arrive .
